messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5-15-2003 10:02:47 AM Mountain Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

> Maybe you can get an all-day visitation? Some schools will allow
> it. Some won't. Maybe if you tell them your child's thinking of attending
>
> they'll see dollar signs and say "Come on down!" (Though "just" a visit
> would involve less wooing and preening than if the teacher saw the kid as a
>
> potential future number, probably.)

I was shocked and dismayed when this plan fell thru for us. Kindergarten has
held a great mystique for Hannah, so I thought a 1/2 day visit would be
perfect. I contacted a friend in a small town (all the big towns have all
day kinder) and asked her to request permission from her dd's teacher. She
explained the whole *homeschooler curious about school* idea and the
teacher's response was, "No, she can't come to visit. If we let her come,
then they'll all want to!" hee hee hee I guess they don't want us *all*
afterall!!
diana,
The wackiest widow westriver...
